intro: Spermacoce cephalophora, commonly known as the crowned sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce cephalophora is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
